text:
hey everyone welcome to Pai's kitchen today I'm 
going to show you a vegan chocolate mousse recipe

now this recipe has quickly become my favorite 
chocolate mousse recipe not because it's vegan

that's a bonus but because it is incredibly easy 
delicious and it's lower fat than the classic

mousse it's also really forgiving so I'm going to 
show you sort of the base recipe and then you can

take it from there and customize it with whatever 
flavouring darkness richness that you want so it's

really fun a fun recipe for you to experiment 
in the kitchen so let's get started so the main

ingredient is of course chocolate so I've got some 
dark chocolate here that I've roughly chopped and

you want to use good quality chocolate for this I 
mean it is basically one of two main ingredients

in this recipe so don't cheap out on this one 
get something that you enjoy eating on its own

so I am using a 70% dark chocolate or you can 
go a little lighter but I would stick with dark

chocolate basically when it says 70% that means 
that the other 30% is sugar so you're going to

use more or less percentage than me then you 
might have to adjust the sugar accordingly and

you can always taste and adjust at the end so 
it's something to keep in mind so I'm going to

melt this chocolate down over a hot water bath 
and I'm going to turn this on just to a simmer

you don't want it boiling away and put this on top 
so I'm going to let that go and now I'm going to

deal with the rest of my ingredients my secret 
ingredient is soft tofu now soft tofu is soft

and silky and it's the perfect thing to give this 
mousse that light velvety luscious texture and add

it to a food processor or a blender of any kind 
and see this is why this is also a much healthier

way of making a chocolate movement classically 
what you would use is cream and also eggs oh

that's another thing a classic chocolate mousse 
contains it's usually because the egg is whipped

and folded in and it's not cooked so sometimes 
you don't want to feed that to pregnant women or

people with compromised immune system so this is a 
good option for those people and now I'm going to

add some sugar and I am using a dark brown sugar 
you can use regular white sugar if you want but I

like that intense molasses flavor that dark brown 
sugar has as I said this very flexible recipe you

can add less sugar more sugar or whatever you 
want a little bit of salt now the next thing

is the fun part flavoring you can flavor this 
however you want if you want to keep it neutral

you can just add a little bit of vanilla which is 
what I'm going to do for this just a smidge Boop

but also if you want to intensify the chocolate 
flavor adding espresso really deepens and darkens

that chocolate flavor what you can also add is all 
sorts of different alcohol so if you want to make

this orange flavored you can add some grown-man 
yay which is a orange flavored liqueur or you

can add Frangelico which is a hazelnut liqueur 
one of my favorite which is Bailey's Irish Cream

Liqueur so your liquor cabinet is the limit or 
your liquor store is the limit to where you can

take this chocolate mousse if you don't want to 
use alcohol you can just use different extracts

mint extract almond extract whatever you want so I 
think today I've already got some coffee in there

I think we're gonna add a splash of Frangelico 
which I love and also all this added liquid is

going to help soften the mousse a little bit 
I'm going to just blitz it up until it's smooth

nice okay so I like to mix this still on the 
water bath I turn it off but I don't want to

take it out right away because if this gets too 
cold once we add the tofu this is going to get

really cold and sometimes a chocolate seizes up 
into clumps so I'm going to add just a little bit

at a time it makes it easier to mix and you'll 
notice it thickening right away almost see and

if you feel that okay it's clumping up too much 
you need a little bit more heat you can just turn

on the pot and it'll help melt the chocolate 
right down it smells so good right now that

coffee that Frangelico from the chocolate and 
it's foolproof nothing can possibly go wrong in

this recipe I know doesn't look like much right 
now but it's coming together in just a second and

that is it it's done your chocolate mousse well 
it's warm right now hey you can actually have a

warm chocolate mousse which is not possible if 
you were making chocolate mousse a traditional

way I like to just run a rubber spatula against 
the bottom because sometimes there's bits of

unmixed chocolate at the bottom and a great 
thing with this recipe is you can taste and

adjust like it were a pot of soup right normally 
with a regular chocolate mousse because it's cold

delicate sort of egg foam involved if you decide 
oh I need it to be a little sweeter you can't just

dump a bunch of sugar at the end so with this 
one you can really play around with it mmm oh

it's even good warm oh that's so good this is 
going to chill into a quite a rich and dense

mousse but if you want to make it a little 
lighter you can take an electric beater and

beat air into this mixture before you let it cool 
so I like to serve it in tiny little mason jars

which i think are super cute okay so now serve 
it with some fresh fruit which is really really

delicious now I'm going to introduce you to the 
cutest fruit for dessert garnishes and that'sa

Cape gooseberries and they come with these little 
outer shell what you want to do if you're using

it for dessert garnish is open it and then 
just grab the top like this and then twist

it and once you twist it it'll sort of stay in 
like this little thing that's just so cute and

then it just adds some nice orange color to your 
chocolate mousse and how cute is that and that

was so easy so that's one way to to plate it if 
you want to keep it vegan and gluten free now if

you are not interested in vegan and gluten-free 
I'm going to show you another way that I like to

do it so for this one I'm going to layer it and 
layered desserts are always super fun so I've got

a little bit of mousse on the bottom I am going 
to add some crushed Oreos and you don't have to

use Oreos if you want to keep this gluten free 
you can put cubes of gluten-free cake and now

the second layer of mousse is going to go in top 
it with more fruit so just the same fruit that we

had earlier I'm going to show you a little trick 
it's called Fanning strawberries and it's really

easy you want to get a strawberry and you want to 
make a slit not all the way to the end but pretty

close and get thin slices it'll fan out better 
okay and then you just kind of push it out and

then it'll fan out just like that look how pretty 
and then as a final garnish this is my Asian side

coming through I'm going to finish it up with some 
Pocky that's right give me a thumbs up if you grow

up with these and I'm talking to you my Asian 
brothers and sisters I know you grew up on these

and they're just really fun cookie steaks covered 
in chocolate or strawberries and I think it'll

just be you know cute thing to add I am gonna try 
this one because I'm feeling very fruity today

it continues to surprise me that this is made 
of chocolate and tofu it's silky its creamy its

super chocolaty I love that added espresso 
really intensify that flavor I'm telling

you when you serve this to your guests don't 
tell them what the secret ingredient is have

them get them they will be blown away now 
I can stand here and eat this all day all

right so the recipe asks obeys will be on Hawkeye 
kitchen calm and when you make it send me a photo

on Facebook Twitter or Instagram and I will see 
you next time for your next delicious adventure
